content:
Hey folks,

Nearly all of our public streams (that is, streams that can be viewed, joined, and interacted with by anyone who joins this Zulip instance) are also "Web Public", which means that you can read the threads without becoming a member of this Zulip instance, and search engines can index threads in the stream.

This #wasi-gfx stream, however, is not web public.

I'd like to get everything consistent, and I also believe there are benefits to allowing people to read threads before creating a Zulip login. Some previous discussion here: https://bytecodealliance.zulipchat.com/#narrow/stream/206238-general/topic/web-public.20streams.3F

Does anyone have any concerns with me flipping this stream over from "public" to "web public"?
Ah, so that's why I couldn't find the stream when I looked on my phone yesterday...
fitzgen (he/him) has marked this topic as resolved.
